trial_identification.studytitle: Acupuncture in the Temporomandibular Disorder: electromyographic analysis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Acupuncture in the Temporomandibular Disorder: electromyographic analysis
trial_identification.secondaryid: the trial has not a secondary ID

interventions.interventions: The acupuncture therapy was performed twice a week, with an average of 30 minutes for five uninterrupted weeks in individuals with temporomandibular disorders. The subjects were evaluated before, immediately after and after 10 sessions by surface electromyography of the masticatory muscles. The temporomandibular acupuncture points of needling were ST5, ST7, TH17, Taiyang, , Yntang, LI4 and GB43, placed in the subject's face, hands and foot.

primaryOutcome.outcome: There was significant reduction in the EMG activity of the left temporallis muscle (p= 0.0062) at rest mandibular position
There was significant reduction in the EMG activity of the left and right temporallis muscles (p= 0.009 and p= 0.002, respectively), at rest mandibular position.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After 10 sessions of the treatment (five weeks)

primaryOutcome.outcome: No difference were observed in the EMG activity of the evaluated muscles during maximal intercuspal position.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediately after each individual session, and then after ten sessions of acupuncture

secondaryOutcome.outcome: An improvement between the masseter and temporalis muscles balance, observed by means of the electromyographic analyzis, was obtained with the treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects with complain of pain in the orofacial region and masticatory muscles.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Presence of dental flaws and subjects under physiotherapeutic or odontological treatment

trial_design.sequence: The first 20 volunteers in the waiting list for treatment took part in the study group and next 20 took part in the control group.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Campus, University, 1000 Roraima Avenue, Camobi, Santa Maria,RS, Brazil, CEP 97105-900

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Campus, University, 1000 Roraima Avenue, Camobi, Santa Maria,RS, Brazil, CEP 97105-900

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Since, temporomandibular is a prevalent condition which causes pain in orofacial region and masticatory muscles, the acupuncture is a therapeutic method that can benefit these patients, yet this is not already enough demonstrated.The study aims to verify the effect of the acupuncture in the electrical activity of masticatory muscles.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Ethics Committee of Federal University of Santa Maria
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: 1000, Roraima Avenue, Camobi, Santa Maria, RS, CEP 97105-900
